Content: Pathfinding should be done on a layered graph. So systems form
subgraphs with clearly defined entry- and exit-points (FTL-points like
gates or warp-points or the system boarder to traverse into
interstellar space). This exit points themselves form a graph in a top
layer. This top layer may then be separated into regions, which form
subgraphs of their own, before the central top graph for the galaxy is
reached. This should speed up local and global pathfinding.
